name: Åse Kleveland
description:
'''Åse Maria Kleveland''' (born 18 March 1949) is a Norwegian singer, guitarist, politician and activist. She represented Norway in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1966]] with the entry "[[Intet er nytt under solen]]".

A well-known folk singer and traditional guitarist in Norway, she was appointed [[Minister of Culture and Church Affairs (Norway)|Minister of Culture]] in Norway in 1990, and held the position until 1996, representing the Labour Party under the [[Gro Harlem Brundtland]] administration. She was also president of the [[Swedish Film Institute]] from 1999 to 2006.

In June 2007, she became [[Chair (official)|chairperson of the board]] of [[Human-Etisk Forbund]], the Norwegian [[humanism|humanist]] organization, a position she held until 2013.
